results.title: Language of the deaf
results.brief_description: Explores the many ways in which deaf people enjoy all facets of life-from rock concerts to playing football - and deals with the social implications of being deaf. Highlighted is the role of Gallaudet College in Washington D.C., the only institution of higher learning in the world for the deaf.

results.title: Language of design
results.brief_description: Illustrates how Australian textile designers are finding inspiration from the local scene. Samples of sea shells, driftwood, dead twigs from a tea-tree, and other such mateerials collected on the Australian beach, are used in the studio to provide motifs for typically Australian textile designs. A series of such designs are effectively displayed by artistically draped samples.

results.title: Language development in multicultural classroom: science
results.creator_credit: Sydney College of Advanced Education and Lisa Milner
results.brief_description: Focuses on how to develop specific language related to science for English as a second Language students. It shows how grade 3 and 4 explored a theme around a unit on Space, providing the viewers with both strategies and practical ideas.

results.title: Language at twelve (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Tom Manefield and Karl McPhee
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Watch Your Language”.
Intended primarily to emphasise the diversity and complexity of language in the life of a 12-year-old. This film focuses on two 12-year-olds who are involved in a school language project. Shows their interaction with a sufficient number of significant people in their lives for us to gain an impression of how the demands upon their speech shift. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Language and learning: talking and literature
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Open University, David Seligman and Caroline Pick
results.brief_description:
Notes the responses of two groups of tertiary students to a piece of literature and emphasises the importance of discussion in the formulation of ideas and problem solving.
Suitable for tertiary levels.

results.title: Language - audience
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Writers on Writing”.
Writers on Writing is based on a growing archive of video material, of conversations between contemporary writers discussing their work. The material has been re-edited to form a resource for students and teachers of English, and each of the six twenty-minute videos focuses on different aspects and stages of the writing process. Each video is accompanied by a resource booklet. In this final video of the series, the use of language is investigated, followed by a discussion on the importance of “audience” for the writer.
